node.title: Police charge longest-serving Queensland mayor with assaulting women
node.description: Charges arise from alleged incident during the annual racing eventÂ in the tiny north Queensland town in August.
node.content: ["A north Queensland mayor is to face court after allegedly assaulting two women security staff.", "Richmond Shire Council Mayor John Wharton, the longest-serving mayor in Queensland's history, has been charged with two counts of common assault and creating a disturbance in a licensed premises.", "Police said the incident happened on the night of the annual Richmond Bush Sprints racing event\u00a0in August, but revealed no other details.", "Cr Wharton, 68, told the ABC he didn't plan to stand aside during proceedings and would \"most definitely\" be fighting the charges.", "The Richmond Bush Sprints is the annual horse racing carnival at tiny Richmond, mid-way between Mount Isa and Townsville,\u00a0which has a permanent population of about 650, according to the most recent census.", "Cr Wharton was first elected to the Richmond Shire Council in 1991 and has been mayor since 1997.", "In 2007, he was made a Member of the Order of Australia for his service\u00a0to the community of north-west Queensland through local government, regional development, natural resource management and primary industry organisations.", "He also received the Centenary Medal for distinguished service to local government.", "He is due to appear in Richmond Magistrates Court on Wednesday."]
